title: What is meant by interface? - Quora

response.answer_text: Interface is just like a class but with a collection of abstract methods. An interface consists of blue print of the class. Interface can have only methods not the method body . Class implement interfaces to extend their abstract methods. For eg an interface will have an abstract method called person and properties of that person like age , gender etc. A class will implement the interface person to form a boy named Yash. So here class used interface to take properties of person and extend a boy named Yash. I hope this will help you to understand interfaces.
If you meant it in IT context then, Interface means an area where interaction between human and machine takes place.
